class.name: VisibilityNotifier
class.brief_description: Detects when the node is visible on screen.
class.description: The VisibilityNotifier detects when it is visible on the screen. It also notifies when its bounding rectangle enters or exits the screen or a [Camera]'s view.

method.name: is_on_screen
method.description: If [code]true[/code], the bounding box is on the screen. [b]Note:[/b] It takes one frame for the node's visibility to be assessed once added to the scene tree, so this method will return [code]false[/code] right after it is instantiated, even if it will be on screen in the draw pass.

signal.name: camera_entered
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier enters a [Camera]'s view.

signal.name: camera_exited
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier exits a [Camera]'s view.

signal.name: screen_entered
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier enters the screen.

signal.name: screen_exited
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier exits the screen.
